html
Class Input

java.lang.Object
  html.Input

public class Input
extends java.lang.Object

This class defines an html input item. It can be used as any java object. There are static final strings in this class that allow you to easily declare wich type of input item you want. This removes the need to remember such things and allows a more object based approach to creating web applications. It removes the need for knowledge on the correct html of these input items. You can use the Types in this class to declare the Type of Input field you need. This type must be passed to all constructors.

Author:
ICT09

Constructor Detail

Input

public Input(java.lang.String name,
             java.lang.String value,
             Type type)
Creates an html input item.

Parameters:
name - the name this item has in a form or page, useful when submitting form data
value - the value to fill this item with
type - the type, you can get a type using Input._TYPE_TEXT or other similar fields.

Input

public Input(java.lang.String name,
             Type type)
Creates an html input item.

Parameters:
name - the name this item has in a form or page, useful when submitting form data
type - the type, you can get a type using Input._TYPE_TEXT or other similar fields.

Input

public Input(java.lang.String name,
             java.lang.String label,
             java.lang.String value,
             java.lang.String checked,
             Type type)
Creates a checkbox type input item

Parameters:
name - the name this item has in a form or page, useful when submitting form data
label - The label to put behind this checkbox
value - The value used when the checkbox is checked
checked - If the value of the checkbox equals the value passed in this parameter, the checkbox is already checked when it is loaded
type - the type, you can get a type using Input._TYPE_CHECKBOX, this constructor works best with the checkbox and radiobutton types
